docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 26 -- The Prensa, great Buenos Aires democratic daily, which ranks among the first half-dozen organs of public opinion in the world was suspended for five days today. It was perhaps the most fearless of all Argentine...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 26 -- The Prensa, great Buenos Aires democratic daily, which ranks among the first half-dozen organs of public opinion in the world was suspended for five days today. It was perhaps the most fearless of all Argentine newspapers in opposition to the policies of the Argentine military governments that succeeded one another since the revolution of June 4, 1943.
docs.abstract: Buenos Aires Prensa ed and Argentine Govt ire cited

headline.main: Prensa of Buenos Aires Is Closed For 5 Days for Offending Cabinet; ARGENTINE PRENSA CLOSED FOR 5 DAYS

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 27 -- Hard on the heels of yesterday's suspension for five days of the great Buenos Aires democratic newspaper, Prensa, comes another most extraordinary measure that emphasizes what the army officers, who at present are...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 27 -- Hard on the heels of yesterday's suspension for five days of the great Buenos Aires democratic newspaper, Prensa, comes another most extraordinary measure that emphasizes what the army officers, who at present are ruling Argentina, think of the press and of its functions.
docs.abstract: Entre Rios Prov bans press mention of religion

headline.main: Argentine Province Bans Mention Of Freedom or Religion by Press; NEW PRESS CURBS SET IN ARGENTINA

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 28 -- How little impression has been made by the breach with the Axis and its satellite states upon Argentina's present rulers is indicated by the fact that Jacques Deniker, charge d'affaires in Buenos Aires of Vichy...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 28 -- How little impression has been made by the breach with the Axis and its satellite states upon Argentina's present rulers is indicated by the fact that Jacques Deniker, charge d'affaires in Buenos Aires of Vichy France, with which Argentina severed relations Feb. 4, was received with full honors when he visited the city of Tucuman recently.

headline.main: ENVOY FROM VICHY FETED IN ARGENTINA; Break With Axis Satellite Has No Effect in Provinces

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The barrack-room Government of Argentina continues to play with Fascism, as though that doctrine were a shiny new toy. Its latest action, taken by the Federal Commissioner in the State of Entre Rios, just north of Buenos Aires on the border of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The barrack-room Government of Argentina continues to play with Fascism, as though that doctrine were a shiny new toy. Its latest action, taken by the Federal Commissioner in the State of Entre Rios, just north of Buenos Aires on the border of Uruguay, is to forbid newspapers even to discuss such subjects as freedom, the Constitution or religion.

docs.snippet: THE first successful sight and sound broadcast held in Uruguay, and perhaps the first in all South America, has gained for a young radio amateur of Montevideo recognition as the leading television pioneer south of the Caribbean.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE first successful sight and sound broadcast held in Uruguay, and perhaps the first in all South America, has gained for a young radio amateur of Montevideo recognition as the leading television pioneer south of the Caribbean.

headline.main: HERE AND THERE IN THE VIDEO WORLD
FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED APRIL 29, 1944
ARGENTINA RESCINDS BAN ON PROSTITUTION; Resorts, Barred Since 1936, to Be Under Government Control

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 4 -- One of the first things that the new Argentine Foreign Minister, Gen. Orlando L. Peluffo, did after taking charge of his post yesterday was to call at the Brazilian Embassy to inquire after the health of Ambassador Jose...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 4 -- One of the first things that the new Argentine Foreign Minister, Gen. Orlando L. Peluffo, did after taking charge of his post yesterday was to call at the Brazilian Embassy to inquire after the health of Ambassador Jose de Paula Rodriguez Alves, who a few hours before had been stricken with a cerebral hemorrhage.

headline.main: BRAZILIANS IGNORE ARGENTINE GESTURE; Embassy Treats Foreign Minister as Ordinary Visitor

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED MAY 6, 1944

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 8 -- The death on Saturday of the Brazilian Ambassador in Argentina, Jose de Paula Rodrigues Alves, has led to what the Argentine Government regards as an implicit recognition by the Brazilian Government of the regime of...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 8 -- The death on Saturday of the Brazilian Ambassador in Argentina, Jose de Paula Rodrigues Alves, has led to what the Argentine Government regards as an implicit recognition by the Brazilian Government of the regime of President Edelmiro Farrell.
docs.abstract: Brazil accepts Argentine offer of cruiser to take body to homeland
